item.title: Annette add a quote by Mike Tyson
item.description: "Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the face." -- Mike Tyson

item.title: Annette add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Annette add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Annette add a quote by David McCullough
item.description: "Real success is finding your lifework in the work that you love." -- David McCullough

item.title: Annette add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "It was time to take the pumpkin out of the pot and eat it. In the final analysis, that was what solved these big problems of life. You could think and think and get nowhere, but you still had to eat your pumpkin. That brought you down to earth. That gave you a reason for going on. Pumpkin." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Annette add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Annette add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "You can’t save others from themselves because those who make a perpetual muddle of their lives don’t appreciate your interfering with the drama they’ve created. They want your poor-sweet-baby sympathy, but they don’t want to change." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: Annette add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Not till we are completely lost or turned around... do we begin to find ourselves." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Annette add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Annette add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Annette add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Annette add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Is that a bulletproof vest? See, now that's so insulting. That's like saying I'm not smart enough to shoot you in the head." Eddie DeChooch" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Annette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Annette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Annette add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Annette add a quote by Stephen R. Covey
item.description: "The ability to subordinate an impulse to a value is the essence of the proactive person." -- Stephen R. Covey

item.title: Annette add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "Jesus said several times, “Come, follow me.” His was a program of “do what I do,” rather than “do what I say.” His innate brilliance would have permitted him to put on a dazzling display, but that would have left his followers far behind. He walked and worked with those he was to serve. His was not a long-distance leadership. He was not afraid of close friendships; he was not afraid that proximity to him would disappoint his followers. The leaven of true leadership cannot lift others unless we are with and serve those to be led." -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Annette add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Where there is great love, there are always miracles." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Annette add a quote by Karen Blixen
item.description: "I know of a cure for everything: salt water...in one way or the other. Sweat, or tears, or the salt sea." -- Karen Blixen

item.title: Annette add a quote by Benjamin Spock
item.description: "Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do." -- Benjamin Spock

item.title: Annette add a quote by Terryl L. Givens
item.description: "What we choose to embrace, to be responsive to, is the purest reflection of who we are and what we love." -- Terryl L. Givens

item.title: Annette add a quote by Terryl L. Givens
item.description: "As an inmate of a concentration camp, Corrie Ten Boom heard a commotion, and saw a short distance away a prison guard mercilessly beating a female prisoner. “What can we do for these people?” Corrie whispered. “Show them that love is greater,” Betsie replied. In that moment, Corrie realized her sister’s focus was on the prison guard, not the victim she was watching. Betsie saw the world through a different lens. She considered the actions of greatest moral gravity to be the ones we originate, not the ones we suffer." -- Terryl L. Givens

item.title: Annette add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "In secret we met In silence I grieve, That thy heart could forget, Thy spirit deceive." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Annette add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness." -- Pearl S. Buck
